adjective.description: Relating or devoted to that which is not sacred or biblical; secular rather than religious.
examples: a talk that tackled topics both sacred and profane

adjective.description: (of a person or their behavior) not respectful of orthodox religious practice; irreverent.
examples: desecration of the temple by profane adolescents

verb.description: Treat (something sacred) with irreverence or disrespect.
examples: it was a serious matter to profane a tomb

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense heathen): from Old French prophane, from Latin profanus outside the temple, not sacred, from pro- (from Latin pro before) + fanum temple.
